ja63:1.1: These first lines were uttered as an imprecation, which according to the commentary was against women. Note, however, that the grammatical gender of these lines is ambiguous except for _akataññū_, which is masculine plural. Either a non-standard form is used, or the story was not originally about women. | _Takka_ normally means “logic”. The story says that a former ascetic was reduced to selling “logic”, employed as adviser by villagers.
ja63:1.4: The reading of _vihāhasi_ is uncertain. I follow the commentary.
